courses.course_name: Integ Sem in Early Child Educ I
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2002 Integ Sem in Early Child Educ I 
Focus on students' evolving teaching philosophy, practices, and research understandings as reflective practitioners based on their field work. Selected community visits.

courses.course_name: Integ Sem in Early Child Educ II
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2003 Integ Sem in Early Child Educ II 
Extension of work in Integrating Seminar I encouraging deeper understanding and further practices. Focus on development as teach-researcher.

courses.course_name: Integ Sem in Early Child Educ III
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2004 Integ Sem in Early Child Educ III 
Extension of work in Integrating Seminar II encouraging examination of practices in early childhood settings through previously acquired skills as teaching-researcher. Exploration of opportunities for advocacy on behalf of children and their families.

courses.course_name: Multcult Persp Soc Study Early Chldhd
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2012 Multcult Persp Soc Study Early Chldhd 
Current theories and practices in multicultural and anti-bias education. Reflection on self and others leading to a critical examination of multiple perspectives. Development of transformative multicultural curricula.

courses.course_name: Child Study for Early Childhood Teachers
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2015 Child Study for Early Childhood Teachers 
Supports teachers in understanding young children by critically integrating empirical, theoretical, and experiential knowledge about children (prenatal through age eight). Careful observations and extended interactions with children provide a basis for revealing important information about the educational, developmental, familial, cultural, historical, sociological, and political contexts in which these children live.

ECED-GE 2024 Issues in Early Childhood Education 
Addresses both historical and contemporary perspectives of child development, as they relate to early childhood programs. Focus on societal contexts, including culture and international perspectives, refugee and immigrant issues, intergenerational child rearing issues, and economics and political policies, as they relate to early childhood programs, including programs for learners with special needs and learners of English as an additional language. Consideration of research and its impact on early childhood programs, with particular attention to advocacy.

ECED-GE 2037 Curr Early Chlhd Educ: 
The early childhood classroom explored as nexus for collaborative, integrative curriculum building, with greater focus on theory. Emphasis on child-centered, culturally inclusive approaches. Study of verbal and nonverbal communication, reading, writing, numeracy, science, social studies, the arts, and an expanded vision of technology appropriate for diverse populations of young children.

courses.course_name: Curric in Early Childhd Ed:Materials and Prac
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2038 Curric in Early Childhd Ed:Materials and Prac 
Further study of issues of integrated early childhood curriculum with greater focus on implementation. In-depth exploration of materials and practices in early childhood classrooms that support evolving integrated integrated curricula in literacy, numeracy, technology, social studies, science, the arts, and health and safety for young children.

ECED-GE 2250 Studying of Teaching 
Students study the process of teaching through real and stimulated situations.  Emphasis on teacher roles, behavior, alternative teaching models, and decision making in the teaching-learning process.  Students are videotaped twice in their placements for purposes of self-analysis.  Students are expected to apply principles and skills in their fieldwork.

ECED-GE 2255 Field Placement in Early Childhood 
University supervised field experiences with young children in a variety of early childhood settings will be used to support coursework.

ECED-GE 2297 Working With Parents 
Development of teacher competence in working with parents and parent organizations.  Considerations of the role of the teacher in parent-child relationships.  Approaches and techniques for effective solutions to home and school problems.  Current research on these issues is discussed.

ECED-GE 2300 Ind Study 
It should be noted that independent study requires a minimum of 45 hours of work per point. Independent study cannot be applied to the established professional education sequence in teaching curricula. Each departmental program has established its own maximum credit allowance for independent study. This information may be obtained from a student?s department. Prior to registering for independent study, each student should obtain an Independent Study Approval Form from the adviser.

courses.course_name: Social Studies and  Science Experiences for Younger Children
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2314 Social Studies and  Science Experiences for Younger Children 
Experiences for developing children’s concepts & skills in social studies & science.  Program planning & use of resources: the out-of-doors, maps, globes, books, pictures & other media.  Includes techniques for integrating the two content areas, evaluating current materials, & adapting programs for special students in regular classrooms.  Hands-on experience with microcomputers & selected software.

courses.course_name: Culmainating Seminar in Early Childhood Educ
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2370 Culmainating Seminar in Early Childhood Educ 
Synthesis of professional experiences in the Graduate Early Childhood Program. Participation in scholarly research, social action, and creation of early childhood curricula.

courses.course_name: Culminating Sem in Early Childhood Education
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2372 Culminating Sem in Early Childhood Education 
No Course Description Available

ECED-GE 2701 Ed of Infants & Toddlers 
Methods of developmental stimulation, selection, creation, and evaluation of materials, group management, and program planning.  This course is one of four parts of an interdepartmental offering in infant and toddler group care.

ECED-GE 2903 Student Teaching Early Childhood I 
One semester supervised student teaching in an early childhood education classroom a minimum of 180 hours within 20 days. Student teaching experiences will be used to support theoretical and practical applications of the planning and implementation of the curriculum.

courses.course_name: Student Teaching in Early Childhood II
courses.description:
ECED-GE 2904 Student Teaching in Early Childhood II 
One semester supervised student teaching in an early childhood classroom a minimum of 180 hours within 20 days. Student teaching experiences will be used to support theoretical and practical applications of the planning and implementation of the curriculum.

ECED-GE 3038 Doctoral Seminar 
The systematic study of theory and research in areas related to early childhood and elementary education.
